DOC.brief_summary: TEAS might protect postoperative pulmonary ischemia-reperfusion injury ( IRI ) atelectasis . We test hypothesis transcutaneous electrical acupoint stimulation protect postoperative pulmonary complication patient receive mechanical ventilation general anesthesia gynecologic laparoscopic surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Pulmonary Protection Transcutaneous Electrical Acupoint Stimulation Gynecologic Laparoscopic Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: Participants : 100 patient underwent elective gynecologic laparoscopic surgery Methods : We recruit 100 patient plan gynecologic laparoscopic surgery . Patients enrol March 1 , 2015 . We randomly allocate patient two group : control group ( patient treat without transcutaneous electrical acupoint stimulation ) TEAS group ( patient treat TEAS Feishu , Hegu , Chize half hour surgery ) . Blood pH , Pco2 , Po2 oxygen saturation measure automatic blood gas analyzer immediately obtain sample aorta . Sample patient blood surgery . And measure level TNF-α , IL-1β , IL-6 .
DOC.criteria: Aged 65 75 The American Society anesthesiologist ( American Society Anesthesiology , ASA ) class Ⅱ ~ III schedule gynecologic laparoscopic surgery general anesthesia preexist lung caridac disease impair kidney liver function history bronchial asthma chronic obstructive pulmonary disease history smoke respiratory infection previous 2 week preoperative use bronchodilator , steroid
